answers.answer: Well, you are old enough to make decisions. Your weight is kind of high for your age. It's very difficult to lose weight. It is often not a question of willpower. Don't be blaming yourself. Often there is a problem with the endochrine system. Talk with your mom or dad about an appointment with an endochronologist, who will evaluate your diabetic status and provide suggestions for weight loss.
I don't have diabetes......... should talk  to my therapist?  Cause my parents will not listen to me.
Sounds like diabetes. You should have your blood glucose checked. Also, DON'T eat the candy. If you are diabetic, you are going to make yourself worse.
I had a fasting blood draw 3 weeks ago and everything looks normal. they checked my thyroid and my glucose.
my mom and dad don't believe me!!!

My parents don't believe me...so who should I talk to? I am homeschooled and i couldn't focus cause I was so tired and grumpy. I am starting to get depressed.... and I cant stop eating ice cream bars and I cream cups!!!

HiWelcome to the MedHelp forum!You definitely need an evaluation by an endocrine specialist. It can be due to diabetes even if fasting and post meal blood sugar levels are normal—you could be having insulin resistance or impaired glucose metabolism.Other than that it can be due to severe acidity, stress, depression, worms in gut, and polycystic ovary.Do discuss this with your doctor and get yourself examined. Talk to your therapist and home tutors. Maybe they can make your parents understand you need an evaluation. Take care!
thanks.. I'll talk to my therapist when she comes tomorrow.

I dont feel like eating anymore and I couldn't talk to my therapist about this. I feel so nauseas that I feel like puking. And I am so so tired I just want to sleep all day. i ate lunch. i had a milk shake and A cheeseburger.  Help me!

I understand what it feels like to be 14 and bashful about talking to your parents about getting this checked.  I had parents much like yours.  They never took me seriously either, so I appreciate what you mean about your parents not believing you.  So, I know how important it is to discuss this with your therapist, because you have to talk to someone who will listen to you.  Especially, since you are a minor and people still make these important decisions for you.While I agree that diabetes is a likely issue, there are other possibilities that should be looked into.  I didn't see anyone mention having your thyroid checked, but that would be a good idea, too.  Fortunately, an endocrinologist treats both conditions.Please try to talk to the therapist again.  You have to talk to an adult in real life who can help you if your parents won't listen to you.  Stress to the therapist how nauseous you feel.  Talk to the therapist about what specifically is bothering you, too.  Emotions do play a huge role in digestive health.  Although, from personal experience, I wouldn't say that it is only emotional health that needs to be looked at.  But, it is a big one.  So, try again to talk to the therapist.  It's really important, because is only going to get bigger until you do what you can yourself.  And, this means talking to an adult in real life who will help you.

I am getting a physical this week... I am going to a summer camp for 6 weeks and they need me to get a physical and send in the papers soon. thanks...but  I won't be seeing my therapist for the next 2-3 weeks. I've been emailing my mom because I can't talk to her in person about this. and Yet she still doesn't believe me.
Definitely tell the doctors you see when you get your physical.  This is too important to ignore.

I haven't been able to eat anything..but drink iced coffee and water..... i eat later that night. i am so tired and grumpy. my mom still hasn't made my appointment but i am going to remind her right know.

I went to my physical but i didn't get the chance to ask my doctor! she said to call back if I remembered what I was going to ask her. My heart rate was fast.... My mom is the only one who calls my doctor. I am having tingling hot feet, and A tingling back. I am super itchy. I was wondering if I should tell my friend about this....my friend is 19 and a really good listener!!! She's the only one who will listen to me.

Yes, tell your friend who is a legal adult.  Your parents are the only ones who can make certain decisions for you legally, but you still need to talk to someone who will listen and who is at least old enough compared to you to be a good confidanté.  Some of what you're experiencing sounds like anxiety symptoms.  Still, any physical causes should still be ruled out.  Besides, anxiety problems can exasperate symptoms you would've had without the anxiety.Forgetting what you needed to talk to the doctor about is classic anxiety.
not even my adult friend will believe me! I lost 11 pounds since  i saw my doctor. I've ran out of adults to talk to!!!! Help..?!
my urine has been very cloudy for several days...

If you can, it would not be wrong to go to an ER on your own, even if you are a minor.  You have to do something.  Your instincts are correct that something is going on.  They have to take you when something is going on, even if you are a minor.  ER's are great for urgent care, and even if this is not an emergency yet, it could become one, which is why going to an ER for urgent care is not out of place.I don't know all the laws about ER's and minors, so don't quote me on everything here, but I do know that if you are certain something is wrong, and I'm sure you are correct here, then by all means do what you can do to take care of what you can.  I believe you, and I know how much it rots to be a minor who no one in real life is taking seriously.  I am truly sorry this is happening in your life.  I had the same kind of experience of not being taken seriously just because I was a kid.Cloudy urine tells me two things:  Everyone's suspicion that this could be diabetes is likely correct.  You could have a urinary tract infection (UTI), too, the cloudy urine seems to possibly suggest.  This, too, could be the result of diabetes.  At the very least, the possibility of UTI must be looked into.  Uncontrolled UTI is horrible for the kidneys.  You don't want this at your very young age.  If this is diabetes, and likely type 2 diabetes, the sooner you get control of it, the better quality of life you will have as an adult.  When a person takes control of the diabetes, a diabetic can live a normal lifespan with a better quality of life than when a diabetic doesn't control the diabetes.Also, being overweight is another high indicator of diabetes.  If you lost eleven pounds in a short amount of time, people do need to take this seriously, because you have also been feeling so lousy.  And, you haven't been all that active because of feeling so lousy, which is another reason why such a fast and significant amount of weight loss and at your age should be taken seriously.  It sounds like you've been paying attention to what you know but the adults in your life are totally missing all these huge clues.  They might be missing the clues because they think losing eleven pounds of weight is a good thing.  Well, you don't want to gain it back.  But, the clue they're not paying attention to is that you lost it without trying to and in a short amount of time.  This is as serious of a clue as you say it is.If you are anywhere near where you can take yourself to an ER in a SAFE manner, that is what I would do as a minor if no one was listening to me and I knew something was wrong with my health.  Please only take yourself in a SAFE manner.  I do believe by the way you are talking that you know how to do this in a SAFE manner and that you are more intelligent than the adults in real life are acting like.What concerns me is that if this is what everyone here thinks it is, the adults in your life won't otherwise listen 'til something serious like passing out unconscious happens and your life is really in danger.  I do believe that your gut instincts are right, even for such a very young age, and something is wrong, like diabetes (probably type 2) and a UTI.  So, I feel strongly that I'm not giving bad advice even to a minor.  I do believe that if no one else is listening that you should go in to an ER.  Do this during the day time hours and make sure you use good discretion and get there in a SAFE manner.  Don't do anything dangerous to get there.  I believe you do know what I mean about being safe, so don't do anything ridiculous.  You can wait 'til daylight hours, during reasonable hours.  This is urgent, but you can wait til reasonable daylight hours.
how do I get there?? I cant drive! im only 14.
my back is tingling.....I might as well give up. These things are happening for reals!!! I am so irritable and  i am having a hard time breathing.

question: i have been really hungry for high sugar foods/ candy! I used to hate candy. but now i crave it regularly. I've been going to the bathroom a lot, and i've been really tired. I'm having a lot of trouble getting out of bed when my dog comes and wakes me up for school. My grandma (my dads mom) recently passed away last year and she had type 2 diabetes. so does my grandpa on my moms side.  I weight 172 and my height is 5 foot, and I am 14 1/2 years old. Please tell me what i should do.. my theriapst is coming tomorrow.... so I have know idea if it's  just my thyroid level being so low or if it's something else????? Please help!?
title: hungry for sugar
